requestBody.description: Properties to update. Partial update is allowed.

post.description: Create a new client OAuth client
Commit schema changes to Git and push to remote.
Upload the file(s) using multipart/form-data to get them staged on the server.
Process the uploaded file into a target schema/table with desired options (dry-run, append, SRS, etc.).

post.summary:
GraphQL POST endpoint.
Accepts a JSON body: { "query": string, "variables": object|null }

unique.description: If the index has a unique constraint

get.description: Get the interfaces for all RPC-JSON methods.

500.description: Internal error. Most like an SQL error.
Internal error. Most like an SQL error.

Call.description: JSON-RPC is a stateless, lightweight remote procedure call (RPC) protocol that uses JSON for data interchange. Defined by the JSON-RPC 2.0 specification, it enables clients to invoke methods on a server by sending JSON-formatted requests and receiving JSON-formatted responses, with support for batch calls, notifications, and standardized error handling.

jsonrpc.title: JSON RPC version
jsonrpc.description: The version number of the JSON-RPC protocol. Must be exactly "2.0".

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier established by the Client that MUST contain a string if included

method.title: Method name
method.description: A String containing the name of the method to be invoked or created

Client.description: OAuth clients are applications that request and manage access to user resources through the OAuth authorization protocol. These clients act as intermediaries, enabling secure, delegated access to user accounts without directly handling sensitive credentials.

id.title: Client id
id.description: Id of client, which identify the client.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of client. Can help identify the client.

homepage.title: Homepage
homepage.description: The homepage (or web-app), which starts the code flow.

description.title: Description
description.description: A longer description of the client, which can help identify the client.

redirect_uri.title: Redirect URIs.
redirect_uri.description: The URIs the auth server is allowed to redirect back to.

public.title: Public
public.description: Public clients do not require a secret.

two_factor.title: Two factor authentication
two_factor.description: Users must log in with two factor authentication.

allow_signup.title: Allow users to sign up
allow_signup.description: Users can sign up for a new account in the web-dialog.

social_signup.title: Enable social signup
social_signup.description: Users can sign up for a new account with social login.

Column.description: Each column has a data type. The data type constrains the set of possible values that can be assigned to a column and assigns semantics to the data stored in the column so that it can be used for computations. For instance, a column declared to be of a numerical type will not accept arbitrary text strings, and the data stored in such a column can be used for mathematical computations. By contrast, a column declared to be of a character string type will accept almost any kind of data but it does not lend itself to mathematical calculations, although other operations such as string concatenation are available.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the column, like varchar, integer, boolean etc.

is_nullable.title: Is nullable
is_nullable.description: If true the column can be set to null.

default_value.title: Default value
default_value.description: The column is set to the default value if no value is given.

identity_generation.title: Identity generation of the column
identity_generation.description: An identity column is a special column that is generated automatically from an implicit sequence. It can be used to generate key values.

repo.title: Repository
repo.description: An Git repository URL with credentials.

meta_query.title: Meta query string
meta_query.description: Only commit meta for this search.

Constraint.description: A constraint is a rule that is enforced on a table to ensure data integrity. Constraints can be used to enforce rules such as uniqueness, foreign key relationships, and check constraints. They help maintain the consistency and accuracy of data in a database.

referenced_table.title: Referenced table
referenced_table.description: Referenced table in a foreign key constraint.

referenced_columns.title: Referenced columns
referenced_columns.description: Referenced columns in a foreign key constraint. This will default to the primary key if omitted.

File.description: Use the Files endpoints to upload one or more files (like CSV files) to temporary storage and then process them into a database table.

import.title: Import
import.description: If false, a dry-run will be executed.

t_srs.title: Target srs
t_srs.description: Fallback target SRS. Will be used if no authority name/code is available.

s_srs.title: Source srs
s_srs.description: Fallback source SRS. Will be used if file doesn't contain projection information.

append.title: Append
append.description: Append to existing table instead of creating new.

p_multi.title: Promote to multi
p_multi.description: Promote single geometries to multi part.

truncate.title: Truncate
truncate.description: Truncate table before appending. Only have effect if --append is set.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: Name of timestamp field. Create a timestamp field in the import table. Omit property for no timestamp field.

x_possible_names.title: Possible names for X
x_possible_names.description: Specify the potential names of the columns that can contain X/longitude. Only effects CSV

y_possible_names.title: Possible names for Y
y_possible_names.description: Specify the potential names of the columns that can contain Y/latitude. Only effects CSV

id.title: Unique identifier
id.description: Id of the rule. If omitted the rule will get an id automatically generated.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: All rules are checked by priority in descending order. The first that matches will be applied.

username.title: Username
username.description: Rule match for user name (the user that makes the request).

layer.title: Layer
layer.description: Rule match for the requested layer(s).

iprange.title: Iprange
iprange.description: Rule match for the iprange, which the request originates from.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: Rule match for the requested schema(s).

access.title: Access
access.description: The access level the rule grants.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: A filter for rules with 'limit' access. This is a valid WHERE clause.

GraphQL.description: The GraphQL API allows you to query and manipulate your database data using a dynamically generated schema. Each table in your schema is automatically mapped to GraphQL types, queries, and mutations.

query.title: Query
query.description: GraphQL query. Both query and mutation operations are supported. Queries retrieve data, while mutations modify data.

variables.title: Variables
variables.description: Variables for the GraphQL query. Should be a JSON object with variable names as keys and their values as values.

operationName.title: Operation name
operationName.description: Name of the operation to execute. Useful when a query contains multiple operations.

Index.description: Indices in a database use a similar approach as in most non-fiction books: terms and concepts that are frequently looked up by readers are collected in an alphabetic index at the end of the book. The interested reader can scan the index relatively quickly and flip to the appropriate page(s), rather than having to read the entire book to find the material of interest.

columns.title: Columns
columns.description: Column(s) to index. An index can comprise more columns.

Method.description: nstead of sending raw SQL every time you want to run a statement, you can wrap your SQL statements inside JSON-RPC methods. This means you define a named method which holds your SQL query along with optional instructions on how to interpret and format the data types.

method.title: Method
method.description: A String containing the name of the method to be created.

q.title: Query
q.description: SQL statement. SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE.

type_hints.title: Type hints
type_hints.description: For JSON represented parameters which are not of JSON type.

type_formats.title: Type formats
type_formats.description: For JSON represented parameters which are not of JSON type.

srs.title: Spatial reference system
srs.description: The spatial reference system to use for PostGIS geometry columns. EPSG code.

OAuth.description: OAuth is used to authenticate users and grant access to resources. It is a protocol that allows users to authorize third-party applications to access their resources without sharing their credentials.

grant_type.title: OAuth grant type
grant_type.description: The OAuth grant type to use for authentication.

username.title: Username
username.description: Username - either database user or sub-user. Only used in password grant.

database.title: Database
database.description: The database the user belongs to.

code.title: Code
code.description: The code which is exchanged for an access token in authorization_code grant

redirect_uri.title: Redirect uri
redirect_uri.description: The redirect uris for authorization_code grant.

OAuthResponse.description: OAuth grant response. This is the final response with tokens.

OAuthDeviceResponse.description: Device response with user code and verification uri.

OAuthDevice.description: Device request for starting a device flow.

Privilege.description: The privilege system enables the super-user to grant sub-users read or write privileges to tables. Sub-users can grant privileges to tables in their own schemas.

privileges.title: Privileges
privileges.description: The privileges granted to the sub-user on a table.

Schema.description: A database contains one or more named schemas, which in turn contain tables. Within one schema, two tables cannot have the same name. The same table name can be used in different schemas without conflict.

Sequence.description: A sequence is a database object that generates a sequence of integers, often used for auto-incrementing primary key columns.

data_type.title: Data type
data_type.description: The data type of the sequence

increment_by.title: Increment by
increment_by.description: Specifies which value is added to the current sequence value to create a new value

min_value.title: Min value
min_value.description: Determines the minimum value a sequence can generate.

max_value.title: Max value
max_value.description: Determines the maximum value for the sequence.

start_value.title: Start value
start_value.description: he initial value of the sequence

cache_size.title: Cache size
cache_size.description: Specifies how many sequence numbers should be preallocated and stored in memory for faster access.

owned_by.title: Qwned by
owned_by.description: Associates the sequence with a specific table column, so that if that column (or its whole table) is deleted, the sequence will be automatically deleted as well. The format is schema.table.column.

Sql.description: SQL query execution endpoint. Supports SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE and MERGE statements.

q.title: Query
q.description: SQL statement. SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE or MERGE.

type_hints.title: Type hints
type_hints.description: For JSON represented parameters which are not of JSON type.

srs.title: Spatial reference system
srs.description: The spatial reference system to use for PostGIS geometry columns. EPSG code.

tables.title: Tables.
tables.description: List of stats for all tables.

total_size.title: Total size
total_size.description: The total size of all tables in human-readable format.

total_size_bytes.title: Total size
total_size_bytes.description: The total size of all tables in bytes.

number_of_tables.title: Number of tables
number_of_tables.description: The total of table in the database

total_size.title: Total size
total_size.description: The total size of the table including indices in human-readable format.

total_size_bytes.title: Total size in bytes
total_size_bytes.description: The total size of the table including indices in bytes.

table_size.title: Table size
table_size.description: The size of the table in human-readable format.

table_size_bytes.title: Table size in bytes
table_size_bytes.description: The size of the table in bytes.

indices_size.title: Indices size
indices_size.description: The size of the table's indices in human-readable format

indices_size_bytes.title: Indices size
indices_size_bytes.description: The size of the table's indices in bytes.

row_count.title: Row count
row_count.description: The number of rows in the table.

Table.description: A table is much like a table on paper: It consists of rows and columns. The number and order of the columns is fixed, and each column has a name. The number of rows is variable  it reflects how much data is stored at a given moment.

password.title: Password
password.description: Users password. Min. 8 characters and at least one upper case letter and one number.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: An object, which can contain any properties and values.

default_user.title: Is default user
default_user.description: The default user is the user that is used when no token is provided. Use for public applications where users should not be able to access data without a token.
